lines.text:
[Gordon brings Stacey a hatbox to carry the jewels in]
Where is the steel-reinforced briefcase with the combination lock? Gordon, what are you trying to do to me?
Stacey, get a hold of yourself! There, there silly! No one will think you're carrying anything valuable in a dumb old hatbox. Lots of people carry hatboxes!
Only in Doris Day movies.

[trying to sneak into a house undetected]
You wanna climb that?
[doubtfully points to an old trellis against the house]
Well, it looks strong enough to me.
[he puts the weight of his foot on a rung and it immediately snaps in two]
Why is this happening to me? I don't even have the jewels! I don't have ANY jewels! I don't even wear earrings!

[talking to herself at the scene of a murder]
What did you do in London, Stacey? Well, I lost a fortune in jewels, and discovered a dead body. I was arrested for withholding evidence in a murder investigation.
[starts to panic]
I really wanted to see Buckingham Palace, but I guess that'll have to wait until I'm on parole!

[speaking to Marvin and Eloise at the airport]
Leave the nice lady alone, ok? Or I'll have you both strapped to the wings.

[rummaging through the nearly-empty fridge]
There's a plague on this house.
What's the matter now?
Just my old war wound acting up again.
What war are we talking about? The Crimean? The Polyponesian?
My "war wound"! You know perfectly well what happened! The sofa collapsed while I was watching "Bridge on the River Kwai."

[eating an unappetizing dinner]
Now you eat your soup or there's no dessert!
Promise?

[after Alistair flips the car]
Way cool driving, dude!

[Marvin is snapping photos of a murder victim]
Hey! What on earth do you think you're doing?
[snatches the camera away]
Give that to me!
Aw, come on Al! That'll go great in my dead things collection!

[At the crime scene]
She is like my goldfish. When you are dead, you go to Heaven.
That may not apply in this case.
Well, she's kinda big to flush down the toilet.
A happy thought there, Marvin. As so many of yours are.
Thanks, Al.
Thanks for seeing us on such short notice, Miss Butler.
Call me Imelda. Everyone else does.

[joins them]
Thanks for letting me freshen up, Miss Butler.

[sarcastically]
Call her Imelda.
Everyone else does!
